description: Borrowed from Latin praeiūdicātus, past participle of praeiūdicō (“pre-judge”). Doublet of prejudge.

adjectives.description: prejudicate (comparative more prejudicate, superlative most prejudicate)

entries.meaning: Preconceived (of an opinion, idea etc.); formed before the event. [from 16th c.]

verbs.description: prejudicate (third-person singular simple present prejudicates, present participle prejudicating, simple past and past participle prejudicated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, now rare) To determine beforehand, especially rashly; to prejudge. [from 16th c.]
